relatedVulnerabilities.description: Included in Log4j 1.2 is a SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data. This affects Log4j versions up to 1.2 up to 1.2.17.

vulnerability.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Log4j

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Apache Santuario XML Security for Java before 1.5.6, when applying Transforms, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via crafted Document Type Definitions (DTDs), related to signatures.

vulnerability.description: Improper Input Validation in Apache Santuario XML Security

relatedVulnerabilities.description: A flaw was found in keycloak, where the default ECP binding flow allows other authentication flows to be bypassed. By exploiting this behavior, an attacker can bypass the MFA authentication by sending a SOAP request with an AuthnRequest and Authorization header with the user's credentials. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and integrity.

vulnerability.description: ECP SAML binding bypasses authentication flows

relatedVulnerabilities.description: By design, the JDBCAppender in Log4j 1.2.x accepts an SQL statement as a configuration parameter where the values to be inserted are converters from PatternLayout. The message converter, %m, is likely to always be included. This allows attackers to manipulate the SQL by entering crafted strings into input fields or headers of an application that are logged allowing unintended SQL queries to be executed. Note this issue only affects Log4j 1.x when specifically configured to use the JDBCAppender, which is not the default. Beginning in version 2.0-beta8, the JDBCAppender was re-introduced with proper support for parameterized SQL queries and further customization over the columns written to in logs. Apache Log4j 1.2 reached end of life in August 2015. Users should upgrade to Log4j 2 as it addresses numerous other issues from the previous versions.

vulnerability.description: SQL Injection in Log4j 1.2.x

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Serialized-object interfaces in certain Cisco Collaboration and Social Media; Endpoint Clients and Client Software; Network Application, Service, and Acceleration; Network and Content Security Devices; Network Management and Provisioning; Routing and Switching - Enterprise and Service Provider; Unified Computing; Voice and Unified Communications Devices; Video, Streaming, TelePresence, and Transcoding Devices; Wireless; and Cisco Hosted Services products allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

vulnerability.description: Insecure Deserialization in Apache Commons Collection

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Apache Commons FileUpload before 1.3.3 DiskFileItem File Manipulation Remote Code Execution

vulnerability.description: Improper Access Control in commons-fileupload

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 7u40 and earlier, Java SE 6u60 and earlier, JRockit R28.2.8 and earlier, JRockit R27.7.6 and earlier, and Java SE Embedded 7u40 and earlier allows remote attackers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Security.

vulnerability.description: Apache XML Security For Java vulnerable to Infinite Loop

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Plexus-utils before 3.0.16 is vulnerable to command injection because it does not correctly process the contents of double quoted strings.

vulnerability.description: OS Command Injection in Plexus-utils

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Integer overflow in the crypt_raw method in the key-stretching implementation in jBCrypt before 0.4 makes it easier for remote attackers to determine cleartext values of password hashes via a brute-force attack against hashes associated with the maximum exponent.

vulnerability.description: Integer Overflow or Wraparound in JBCrypt

relatedVulnerabilities.description: The deepGetOrCreateNode function in impl/operations/AbstractCreateOperation.java in org.apache.sling.servlets.post.bundle 2.2.0 and 2.3.0 in Apache Sling does not properly handle a NULL value that returned when the session does not have permissions to the root node, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via unspecified vectors.

vulnerability.description: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer in Apache Sling

relatedVulnerabilities.description: CVE-2020-9493 identified a deserialization issue that was present in Apache Chainsaw. Prior to Chainsaw V2.0 Chainsaw was a component of Apache Log4j 1.2.x where the same issue exists.

vulnerability.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Apache Log4j

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Red Hat JBoss A-MQ 6.x; BPM Suite (BPMS) 6.x; BRMS 6.x and 5.x; Data Grid (JDG) 6.x; Data Virtualization (JDV) 6.x and 5.x; Enterprise Application Platform 6.x, 5.x, and 4.3.x; Fuse 6.x; Fuse Service Works (FSW) 6.x; Operations Network (JBoss ON) 3.x; Portal 6.x; SOA Platform (SOA-P) 5.x; Web Server (JWS) 3.x; Red Hat OpenShift/xPAAS 3.x; and Red Hat Subscription Asset Manager 1.3 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted serialized Java object, related to the Apache Commons Collections (ACC) library.

vulnerability.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Apache commons collections

relatedVulnerabilities.description: JMSAppender in Log4j 1.2 is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data when the attacker has write access to the Log4j configuration. The attacker can provide TopicBindingName and TopicConnectionFactoryBindingName configurations causing JMSAppender to perform JNDI requests that result in remote code execution in a similar fashion to CVE-2021-44228. Note this issue only affects Log4j 1.2 when specifically configured to use JMSAppender, which is not the default. Apache Log4j 1.2 reached end of life in August 2015. Users should upgrade to Log4j 2 as it addresses numerous other issues from the previous versions.

vulnerability.description: JMSAppender in Log4j 1.2 is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data

relatedVulnerabilities.description: In Apache Commons IO before 2.7, When invoking the method FileNameUtils.normalize with an improper input string, like "//../foo", or "\\..\foo", the result would be the same value, thus possibly providing access to files in the parent directory, but not further above (thus "limited" path traversal), if the calling code would use the result to construct a path value.

vulnerability.description: Path Traversal and Improper Input Validation in Apache Commons IO

relatedVulnerabilities.description: plexus-archiver before 3.6.0 is vulnerable to directory traversal, allowing attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in an archive entry that is mishandled during extraction. This vulnerability is also known as 'Zip-Slip'.

vulnerability.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory in plexus-archiver

relatedVulnerabilities.description: All versions of Apache Santuario - XML Security for Java prior to 2.2.3 and 2.1.7 are vulnerable to an issue where the "secureValidation" property is not passed correctly when creating a KeyInfo from a KeyInfoReference element. This allows an attacker to abuse an XPath Transform to extract any local .xml files in a RetrievalMethod element.

vulnerability.description: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor in Apache Santuario

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Apache Sling Commons Log <= 5.4.0 and Apache Sling API <= 2.25.0 are vulnerable to log injection. The ability to forge logs may allow an attacker to cover tracks by injecting fake logs and potentially corrupt log files.

vulnerability.description: Log Injection in Apache Sling Commons Log and Apache Sling API

relatedVulnerabilities.description: jcp/xml/dsig/internal/dom/DOMCanonicalizationMethod.java in Apache Santuario XML Security for Java 1.4.x before 1.4.8 and 1.5.x before 1.5.5 allows context-dependent attackers to spoof an XML Signature by using the CanonicalizationMethod parameter to specify an arbitrary weak "canonicalization algorithm to apply to the SignedInfo part of the Signature."

vulnerability.description: Inefficient Algorithmic Complexity in Apache Santuario XML Security

relatedVulnerabilities.description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Apache Sling API before 2.2.2 and Apache Sling Servlets Post before 2.1.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the URI, related to (1) org/apache/sling/api/servlets/HtmlResponse and (2) org/apache/sling/servlets/post/HtmlResponse.

vulnerability.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation in Apache Sling

relatedVulnerabilities.description: JMSSink in all versions of Log4j 1.x is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data when the attacker has write access to the Log4j configuration or if the configuration references an LDAP service the attacker has access to. The attacker can provide a TopicConnectionFactoryBindingName configuration causing JMSSink to perform JNDI requests that result in remote code execution in a similar fashion to CVE-2021-4104. Note this issue only affects Log4j 1.x when specifically configured to use JMSSink, which is not the default. Apache Log4j 1.2 reached end of life in August 2015. Users should upgrade to Log4j 2 as it addresses numerous other issues from the previous versions.

vulnerability.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Log4j 1.x

Misconfigurations.Description: When using a 'FROM' statement you should use a specific tag to avoid uncontrolled behavior when the image is updated.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify a tag in the 'FROM' statement for image 'juliantotzek/verademo1-tomcat'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a tag to the image in the 'FROM' statement
Misconfigurations.Title: ':latest' tag used

Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'

Misconfigurations.Description: Exposing port 22 might allow users to SSH into the container.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'EXPOSE 22' statement from the Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Title: Port 22 exposed

Misconfigurations.Description: You should use COPY instead of ADD unless you want to extract a tar file. Note that an ADD command will extract a tar file, which adds the risk of Zip-based vulnerabilities. Accordingly, it is advised to use a COPY command, which does not extract tar files.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use COPY instead of ADD
Misconfigurations.Title: ADD instead of COPY

Misconfigurations.Description: COPY '--from' should not mention the current FROM alias, since it is impossible to copy from itself.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change the '--from' so that it will not refer to itself
Misconfigurations.Title: COPY '--from' referring to the current image

Misconfigurations.Description: There can only be one ENTRYPOINT instruction in a Dockerfile. Only the last ENTRYPOINT instruction in the Dockerfile will have an effect.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove unnecessary ENTRYPOINT instruction.
Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple ENTRYPOINT instructions listed

Misconfigurations.Description: UNIX ports outside the range 0-65535 are exposed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use port number within range
Misconfigurations.Title: Exposed port out of range

Misconfigurations.Description: For clarity and reliability, you should always use absolute paths for your WORKDIR.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use absolute paths for your WORKDIR
Misconfigurations.Title: WORKDIR path not absolute

Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using 'RUN' with 'sudo' commands, as it can lead to unpredictable behavior.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Don't use sudo
Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'sudo'

Misconfigurations.Description: When a COPY command has more than two arguments, the last one should end with a slash.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add slash to last COPY argument
Misconfigurations.Title: COPY with more than two arguments not ending with slash

Misconfigurations.Description: Different FROMs can't have the same alias defined.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change aliases to make them different
Misconfigurations.Title: Duplicate aliases defined in different FROMs

Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd … && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use WORKDIR to change directory
Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory

Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using both 'wget' and 'curl' since these tools have the same effect.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Pick one util, either 'wget' or 'curl'
Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'wget' and 'curl'

Misconfigurations.Description: You should use 'yum clean all' after using a 'yum install' command to clean package cached data and reduce image size.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'yum clean all' to Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Title: 'yum clean all' missing

Misconfigurations.Description: There can only be one CMD instruction in a Dockerfile. If you list more than one CMD then only the last CMD will take effect.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Dockefile should only have one CMD instruction. Remove all the other CMD instructions
Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple CMD instructions listed

Misconfigurations.Description: The instruction 'RUN <package-manager> update' should always be followed by '<package-manager> install' in the same RUN statement.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Combine '<package-manager> update' and '<package-manager> install' instructions to single one
Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN <package-manager> update' instruction alone

Misconfigurations.Description: Cached package data should be cleaned after installation to reduce image size.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'dnf clean all' to Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Title: 'dnf clean all' missing

Misconfigurations.Description: The layer and image size should be reduced by deleting unneeded caches after running zypper.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'zypper clean' to Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Title: 'zypper clean' missing

Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' calls should use the flag '-y' to avoid manual user input.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add '-y' flag to 'apt-get'
Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '-y' to avoid manual input

Misconfigurations.Description: MAINTAINER has been deprecated since Docker 1.13.0.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use LABEL instead of MAINTAINER
Misconfigurations.Title: Deprecated MAINTAINER used

Misconfigurations.Description: Providing more than one HEALTHCHECK instruction per stage is confusing and error-prone.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: One HEALTHCHECK instruction must remain in Dockerfile. Remove all other instructions.
Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple HEALTHCHECK defined

Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' upgrades a major version so it doesn't make more sense in Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Just use different image
Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' used

Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello' of Pod 'hello' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Process can elevate its own privileges

Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello' of Pod 'hello' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities not dropped

Misconfigurations.Description: Mounting docker.sock from the host can give the container full root access to the host.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not specify /var/run/docker.socket in 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath.path'.
Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volume mounted with docker.sock

Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s IPC namespace allows container processes to communicate with processes on the host.
Misconfigurations.Message: Pod 'hello' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostIPC' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostIPC' to true.
Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host IPC namespace

Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited

Misconfigurations.Description: 'runAsNonRoot' forces the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello' of Pod 'hello' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user

Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello' of Pod 'hello' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ':latest' used

Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello' of Pod 'hello' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only

Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified

Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified

Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited

Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low user ID

Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.
Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low group ID

Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath'.
Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted

Misconfigurations.Description: Setting a custom SELinux user or role option should be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.securityContext.seLinuxOptions', spec.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions and spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.
Misconfigurations.Title: SELinux custom options set

Misconfigurations.Description: The RuntimeDefault/Localhost seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
Misconfigurations.Title: Default Seccomp profile not set

Misconfigurations.Description: Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE

Misconfigurations.Description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set '--anonymous-auth' to 'false'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not use token based authentication.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the documentation and configure alternate mechanisms for authentication. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and remove the --token-auth-file=<filename> parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set

Misconfigurations.Description: This admission controller rejects all net-new usage of the Service field externalIPs.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file $apiserverconf on the control plane node and remove the `DenyServiceExternalIPs` from enabled admission plugins.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set

Misconfigurations.Description: Use https for kubelet connections.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and remove the --kubelet-https parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between the apiserver and kubelets.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Verify kubelet's certificate before establishing connection.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and setup the TLS connection between the apiserver and kubelets.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not always authorize all requests.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to values other than AlwaysAllow.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow

Misconfigurations.Description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to a value that includes Node.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node

Misconfigurations.Description: Turn on Role Based Access Control.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to a value that includes RBAC.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC

Misconfigurations.Description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set the desired limits in a configuration file. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml and set the below parameters.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not allow all requests.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and either remove the --enable-admission- plugins parameter, or set it to a value that does not include AlwaysAdmit.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set

Misconfigurations.Description: Always pull images.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to include AlwaysPullImages.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set

Misconfigurations.Description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to include SecurityContextDeny, unless PodSecurityPolicy is already in place.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used

Misconfigurations.Description: Automate service accounts management.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the documentation and create ServiceAccount objects as per your environment. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and ensure that the --disable-admission-plugins parameter is set to a value that does not include ServiceAccount.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set

Misconfigurations.Description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --disable-admission-plugins parameter to ensure it does not include NamespaceLifecycle.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set

Misconfigurations.Description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and configure NodeRestriction plug-in on kubelets. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to a value that includes NodeRestriction.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not disable the secure port.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and either remove the --secure-port parameter or set it to a different (non-zero) desired port.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0

Misconfigurations.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false

Misconfigurations.Description: Enable auditing on the Kubernetes API Server and set the desired audit log path.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --audit-log-path parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-path argument is set

Misconfigurations.Description: Retain the logs for at least 30 days or as appropriate.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --audit-log-maxage parameter to 30 or as an appropriate number of days.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Retain 10 or an appropriate number of old log files.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --audit-log-maxbackup parameter to 10 or to an appropriate value.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Rotate log files on reaching 100 MB or as appropriate.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --audit-log-maxsize parameter to an appropriate size in MB
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Validate service account before validating token.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-lookup argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Explicitly set a service account public key file for service accounts on the apiserver.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --service-account-key-file parameter to the public key file for service accounts.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between the apiserver and etcd. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the etcd certificate and key file parameters.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection on the apiserver. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the TLS certificate and private key file parameters.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection on the apiserver. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the client certificate authority file.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between the apiserver and etcd. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the etcd certificate authority file parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Encrypt etcd key-value store.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and configure a EncryptionConfig file. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --encryption-provider-config parameter to the path of that file
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold to an appropriate threshold.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false

Misconfigurations.Description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node to set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --service-account-private-key-file parameter to the private key file for service accounts.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --root-ca-file parameter to the certificate bundle file`.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation on controller-manager.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and set the --feature-gates parameter to include RotateKubeletServerCertificate=true .
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml on the Control Plane node and ensure the correct value for the --bind-address parameter
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1

Misconfigurations.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Scheduler pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-scheduler.yaml file on the Control Plane node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the Scheduler pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-scheduler.yaml on the Control Plane node and ensure the correct value for the --bind-address parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1

Misconfigurations.Description: Configure TLS encryption for the etcd service.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the etcd service documentation and configure TLS encryption. Then, edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and set the below parameters.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --cert-file and --key-file arguments are set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: Enable client authentication on etcd service.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --client-cert-auth argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and either remove the --auto-tls parameter or set it to false.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --auto-tls argument is not set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for peer connections.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Follow the etcd service documentation and configure peer TLS encryption as appropriate for your etcd cluster. Then, edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and set the below parameters.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --peer-cert-file and --peer-key-file arguments are set as appropriate

Misconfigurations.Description: etcd should be configured for peer authentication.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and set the below parameter.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --peer-client-cert-auth argument is set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Edit the etcd pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml on the master node and either remove the --peer-auto-tls parameter or set it to false.
Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --peer-auto-tls argument is not set to true

Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass AppArmor protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'container.apparmor.security.beta.kubernetes.io' annotation or set it to 'runtime/default'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Default AppArmor profile not set

Misconfigurations.Description: SYS_ADMIN gives the processes running inside the container privileges that are equivalent to root.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove the SYS_ADMIN capability from 'containers[].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
Misconfigurations.Title: SYS_ADMIN capability added

Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the host’s loopback adapter.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true.
Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network

Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' to true.
Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID

Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.privileged' to 'false'.
Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged container

Misconfigurations.Description: Adding NET_RAW or capabilities beyond the default set must be disallowed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add and spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add
Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default capabilities added

Misconfigurations.Description: HostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].ports[*].hostPort and spec.initContainers[*].ports[*].hostPort.
Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host ports

Misconfigurations.Description: Sysctls can disable security mechanisms or affect all containers on a host, and should be disallowed except for an allowed 'safe' subset. A sysctl is considered safe if it is namespaced in the container or the Pod, and it is isolated from other Pods or processes on the same Node.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.securityContext.sysctls' or set to values in an allowed subset
Misconfigurations.Title: Unsafe sysctl options set

Misconfigurations.Description: The default /proc masks are set up to reduce attack surface, and should be required.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].securityContext.procMount and spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.procMount.
Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default /proc masks set

Misconfigurations.Description: In addition to restricting HostPath volumes, usage of non-ephemeral volume types should be limited to those defined through PersistentVolumes.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*]' to any of the disallowed volume types.
Misconfigurations.Title: Non-ephemeral volume types used

Misconfigurations.Description: ensure that Pod specifications disable the secret token being mounted by setting automountServiceAccountToken: false
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Disable the mounting of service account secret token by setting automountServiceAccountToken to false
Misconfigurations.Title: Protecting Pod service account tokens

Misconfigurations.Description: ensure that User pods are not placed in kube-system namespace
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Deploy the use pods into a designated namespace which is not kube-system.
Misconfigurations.Title: User Pods should not be placed in kube-system namespace

Misconfigurations.Description: ensure that network policies selectors are applied to pods or namespaces to restricted ingress and egress traffic within the pod network
Misconfigurations.Resolution: create network policies and ensure that pods are selected using the podSelector and/or the namespaceSelector options
Misconfigurations.Title: Selector usage in network policies

Misconfigurations.Description: Check if Helm Tiller component is deployed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Migrate to Helm v3 which no longer has Tiller component
Misconfigurations.Title: Tiller Is Deployed

Misconfigurations.Description: Windows pods offer the ability to run HostProcess containers which enable privileged access to the Windows node.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not enable 'hostProcess' on any securityContext
Misconfigurations.Title: HostProcess container defined

Misconfigurations.Description: Seccomp profile must not be explicitly set to 'Unconfined'.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set seccomp profile to 'Unconfined'
Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp profile unconfined

Misconfigurations.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root UID.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'securityContext.runAsUser' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.
Misconfigurations.Title: Containers must not set runAsUser to 0

Misconfigurations.Description: apiVersion and kind has been deprecated
Misconfigurations.Resolution: It recommended to move to the replacement API
Misconfigurations.Title: Evaluate k8s deprecated and removed APIs
